span.span: Represents a decimal number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值类型表示十进制数字范围从-79228162514264337593543950335 到 + 79228162514264337593543950335。The value type represents decimal numbers ranging from positive 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 to negative 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335. 默认值`Decimal`为 0。The default value of a `Decimal` is 0. 值类型是适用于需要大量的有效整数和小数位数和无舍入误差的财务计算。The value type is appropriate for financial calculations that require large numbers of significant integral and fractional digits and no round-off errors. 类型并不能排除需要舍入。The type does not eliminate the need for rounding. 相反，它最大程度减少由于舍入导致的错误。Rather, it minimizes errors due to rounding. 例如，下面的代码生成而不是 1 0.9999999999999999999999999999 的结果。For example, the following code produces a result of 0.9999999999999999999999999999 instead of 1. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#1)] 当部门和乘法的结果传递给方法，结果不会有损失精度，如以下代码所示。When the result of the division and multiplication is passed to the method, the result suffers no loss of precision, as the following code shows. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#2)] 十进制数字是包含一个符号的浮点值，其中每个数字的值介于 0 到 9 的数字值和指示浮动小数点分隔的整数和小数部分的位置的缩放系数数字值。A decimal number is a floating-point value that consists of a sign, a numeric value where each digit in the value ranges from 0 to 9, and a scaling factor that indicates the position of a floating decimal point that separates the integral and fractional parts of the numeric value. 二进制表示形式1 位符号、 96 位整数和用作除数的 96 位整数，并指定它的哪些部分是小数部分的缩放系数的值组成。The binary representation of a value consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the 96-bit integer and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 比例因子是隐式数字 10，范围从 0 到 28 的指数。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 因此，二进制表示形式值在窗体 ((-296为 296) / 10(0 到 28))，其中的 (296为-1)等同于，并 296-1 等同于。Therefore, the binary representation of a value the form, ((-296 to 296) / 10(0 to 28)), where -(296-1) is equal to , and 296-1 is equal to . 有关更多信息的二进制表示形式值和示例，请参阅构造函数和方法。For more information about the binary representation of values and an example, see the constructor and the method. 比例因子还保留在任何尾随零数。The scaling factor also preserves any trailing zeros in a number. 尾随零不会影响值以算术或比较运算数。Trailing zeros do not affect the value of a number in arithmetic or comparison operations. 但是，尾随零可能会透露通过方法，如果应用正确的格式字符串。However, trailing zeros might be revealed by the method if an appropriate format string is applied. ## 有关转换的注意事项Conversion Considerations 此类型提供了将转换的方法值与， ， ， ， ， ， ，和值。This type provides methods that convert values to and from , , , , , , , and values. 从到这些整型转换扩大转换，永远不会丢失信息或引发异常。Conversions from these integral types to are widening conversions that never lose information or throw exceptions. 从转换到任何整型类型收缩转换的舍入到最接近的整数值接近零的值。Conversions from to any of the integral types are narrowing conversions that round the value to the nearest integer value toward zero. 某些语言中的，如 C# 中，还支持的转换值到值。Some languages, such as C#, also support the conversion of values to values. 如果不能在目标类型中表示这些转换的结果引发异常。If the result of these conversions cannot be represented in the destination type, an exception is thrown. 类型还提供了将转换的方法值到和从和值。The type also provides methods that convert values to and from and values. 从转换到或收缩转换可能会丢失精度，但不是有关信息的量值的转换后的值。Conversions from to or are narrowing conversions that might lose precision but not information about the magnitude of the converted value. 转换不会引发异常。The conversion does not throw an exception. 从转换或到引发异常，如果转换的结果不能表示为。Conversions from or to throw an exception if the result of the conversion cannot be represented as a . ## 对十进制值执行操作Performing Operations on Decimal Values 类型支持标准的数学运算，例如加法、 减法、 除法、 乘法和一元求反。The type supports standard mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, and unary negation. 此外可以直接使用的二进制表示形式值通过调用方法。You can also work directly with the binary representation of a value by calling the method. 比较两个值，可以使用标准数值比较运算符，也可以调用或方法。To compare two values, you can use the standard numeric comparison operators, or you can call the or method. 您还可以调用的成员类来执行各种数值操作，包括如何确定两个最大或最小值的某个数字的绝对值值，获取数字的符号和舍入一个数字。You can also call the members of the class to perform a wide range of numeric operations, including getting the absolute value of a number, determining the maximum or minimum value of two values, getting the sign of a number, and rounding a number. ## Examples 以下代码示例演示了 的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of . remarks.format: ## Remarks 二进制表示形式1 位符号、 96 位整数和用于分隔整数，并指定它的哪些部分是小数部分的缩放系数的数字组成。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 比例因子是隐式数字 10，范围从 0 到 28 的指数。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. `bits` 是 32 位有符号整数的四个元素长数组。`bits` is a four-element long array of 32-bit signed integers. `bits` [0] `bits` [1] 和`bits`[2] 包含 96 位整数号的低、 中和高 32 位。`bits` [0], `bits` [1], and `bits` [2] contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. `bits` [3] 包含的缩放比例和登录，并由以下部分组成：`bits` [3] contains the scale factor and sign, and consists of following parts: 位 0 到 15，较低的字，未使用，必须为零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 16 到 23 位必须包含一个介于 0 到 28，之间的指数表示 10 的强大功能将整数值。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 24 到 30 位未使用，必须为零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 第 31 位包含登录;0 的含义正类和 1 表示负数。Bit 31 contains the sign; 0 meaning positive, and 1 meaning negative. 数字值可能具有多个可能二进制表示形式;所有都同样有效和数值上相等。A numeric value might have several possible binary representations; all are equally valid and numerically equivalent. 请注意，位表示形式区分正负零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 这些值被视为相等的所有操作中。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建的多个`Decimal`数字使用初始化的构造函数重载`Decimal`结构具有四个数组值。The following code example creates several `Decimal` numbers using the constructor overload that initializes a `Decimal` structure with an array of four values. Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers may perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of all primitive integral types, including both signed and unsigned types, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 二进制表示形式1 位符号、 96 位整数和用于分隔整数，并指定它的哪些部分是小数部分的缩放系数的数字组成。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 比例因子是隐式数字 10，范围从 0 到 28 的指数。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 返回值为 32 位有符号整数的一个四个元素的数组。The return value is a four-element array of 32-bit signed integers. 第一，第二，并返回数组的第三个元素包含 96 位整数号的低、 中和高 32 位。The first, second, and third elements of the returned array contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. 返回数组的第四个元素包含的缩放比例和登录。The fourth element of the returned array contains the scale factor and sign. 它包含以下几个部分：It consists of the following parts: 位 0 到 15，较低的字，未使用，必须为零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 16 到 23 位必须包含一个介于 0 到 28，之间的指数表示 10 的强大功能将整数值。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 24 到 30 位未使用，必须为零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 第 31 位包含符号： 0 表示正数，而 1 表示负数。Bit 31 contains the sign: 0 mean positive, and 1 means negative. 请注意，位表示形式区分正负零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 这些值被视为相等的所有操作中。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下面的示例使用`GetBits`方法将多个`Decimal`为其等效的二进制表示形式的值。The following example uses the `GetBits` method to convert several `Decimal` values to their equivalent binary representations. 它然后显示十进制值和元素的十六进制值的数组中返回的方法。It then displays the decimal values and the hexadecimal value of the elements in the array returned by the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 重载方法定义的类型，编译器可自动转换从中而无需使用显式强制转换运算符 （在 C#) 或调用转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中) 的值。The overloads of the method define the types from which the compiler can automatically convert a value without an explicit casting operator (in C#) or a call to a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 它们扩大转换，不会丢失数据，不会引发异常。They are widening conversions that do not involve data loss and do not throw an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的行为遵循 IEEE 标准 754，第 4 节。The behavior of this method follows IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 这种舍入有时称为*舍入一半甚至*或*银行家的舍入*。This kind of rounding is sometimes called *round half to even* or *banker's rounding*. 它最小化而导致的持续舍入中在单方向上的中点值舍入误差。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. 它相当于调用方法替换`mode`自变量的。It is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of . ## Examples 下面的示例将一系列介于 100 和 102 到最接近的整数值。The following example rounds a range of values between 100 and 102 to the nearest integer. 因为该方法使用银行家的舍入，请注意，100.5 舍入为 100 和 101.5 将舍入到 102。Because the method uses banker's rounding, note that 100.5 rounds to 100 and 101.5 rounds to 102. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法相当于调用方法替换`mode`自变量的。当`d`完全中间两个舍入值，结果是最右边的数位中有偶数位的舍入的值。This method is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of .When `d` is exactly halfway between two rounded values, the result is the rounded value that has an even digit in the far right decimal position. 例如，当舍入为两位小数时，值 2.345 变成 2.34，而值 2.355 变成 2.36。For example, when rounded to two decimals, the value 2.345 becomes 2.34 and the value 2.355 becomes 2.36. 此过程被称为*向偶舍*，或*银行家的舍入*。This process is known as *rounding toward even*, or *banker's rounding*. 它最小化而导致的持续舍入中在单方向上的中点值舍入误差。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. ## Examples 下面的示例将多个`Decimal`到指定的小数位数使用值`Round`方法。The following example rounds several `Decimal` values to a specified number of decimal places using the `Round` method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在一个中点值后结果中的最高有效位, 的值是两个数字之间准确地说的一半。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 例如，7.5 是中点值，如果要舍入为整数。For example, 7.5 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 中点值，而无需使用舍入的约定，指定的最接近的值不能轻松识别操作`mode`参数。For midpoint values, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支持两种舍入的约定来处理中点值。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 远离零方向舍入。Rounding away from zero. 中点值舍入为下一个编号从零开始。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 例如，3.5 则舍入为 4，4.5 将舍入到 5，-3.5 舍入到-4，和-4.5 对齐舍入到-5。For example, 3.5 rounds to 4, 4.5 rounds to 5, -3.5 rounds to -4, and -4.5 rounds to -5. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 远离零方向舍入为最广泛已知的形式的舍入。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 甚至，舍入或银行家的舍入Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中点值舍入为最接近的偶数。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，3.5 和 4.5 舍入为 4，和-3.5 和-4.5 对齐舍入到-4。For example, both 3.5 and 4.5 round to 4, and both -3.5 and -4.5 round to -4. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 舍入为最接近是标准形式的舍入在财务和统计操作中使用。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 它符合 IEEE 标准 754，第 4 节。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 多个舍入操作中使用时，它减少了通过一致地在单方向的中点值舍入导致的舍入错误。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情况下，此舍入错误非常显著。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下面的示例显示返回的值方法，方法替换`mode`自变量，和方法替换`mode`自变量的。The following example displays values returned by the method, the method with a `mode` argument of , and the method with a `mode` argument of . remarks.format: ## Remarks `decimals`参数指定的返回值中的有效小数位数数，介于 0 到 28。The `decimals` parameter specifies the number of significant decimal places in the return value and ranges from 0 to 28. 如果`decimals`为零，则返回一个整数。If `decimals` is zero, an integer is returned. 在一个中点值后结果中的最高有效位, 的值是两个数字之间准确地说的一半。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 例如，3.47500 是一个中点值，如果要舍入两个小数位，而且 7.500 是一个中点值，如果要舍入为整数。For example, 3.47500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded two decimal places, and 7.500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 在这些情况下，而无需使用舍入的约定，指定的最接近的值不能轻松识别操作`mode`参数。In these cases, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支持两种舍入的约定来处理中点值。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 远离零方向舍入。Rounding away from zero. 中点值舍入为下一个编号从零开始。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 例如，3.75 将舍入到 3.8，3.85 将舍入到 3.9，-3.75 舍入到-3.8，和-3.85 舍入到-3.9。For example, 3.75 rounds to 3.8, 3.85 rounds to 3.9, -3.75 rounds to -3.8, and -3.85 rounds to -3.9. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 远离零方向舍入为最广泛已知的形式的舍入。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 甚至，舍入或银行家的舍入Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中点值舍入为最接近的偶数。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，3.75 和 3.85 舍入到 3.8，和-3.75 和-3.85 舍入到-3.8。For example, both 3.75 and 3.85 round to 3.8, and both -3.75 and -3.85 round to -3.8. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 舍入为最接近是标准形式的舍入在财务和统计操作中使用。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 它符合 IEEE 标准 754，第 4 节。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 多个舍入操作中使用时，它减少了通过一致地在单方向的中点值舍入导致的舍入错误。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情况下，此舍入错误非常显著。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法替换枚举。The following example demonstrates how to use the method with the enumeration. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式使用当前区域性的约定将指定格式的值。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果想要使用默认值 （"G"或常规） 格式或指定不同的区域性，请使用的其他重载方法，按如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| 方法使用指定的标准或自定义数字格式字符串`format`参数，以将当前实例的值转换成其字符串表示形式。The method uses the standard or custom numeric format string specified by the `format` parameter to convert the value of the current instance into its string representation. `format`参数可以是任何有效[标准数字格式说明符](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)除 D、 R、 X，以及的任意组合[自定义数字格式说明符](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric format specifier](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) except for D, R, and X, as well as any combination of [custom numeric format specifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`是`null`或空字符串，此实例的返回值格式与常规的数字格式说明符 (G)。If `format` is `null` or an empty string, the return value of this instance is formatted with the general numeric format specifier (G). .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，其格式设置的以下主题中更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 使用格式化的返回值为当前区域性的对象。The return value is formatted by using the object for the current culture. 若要将应用指定的区域性的格式设置约定，请调用方法。To apply the formatting conventions of a specified culture, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例显示值使用每个受支持的标准数字格式说明符，以及两个自定义数字格式字符串。The following example displays a value using each of the supported standard numeric format specifiers, together with two custom numeric format strings. 在将该数字值转换为字符串，该示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定。In converting the numeric values to strings, the example uses the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载不同于通过返回一个布尔值，该值指示是否分析操作成功而不是返回的已分析的数字值的方法。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 它消除了需要使用异常处理来测试的事件中`s`无效，不能成功分析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. 参数`s`包含多个窗体：Parameter `s` contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|特定于区域性的千位分隔符号。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 参数`s`使用解释样式。Parameter `s` is interpreted using the style. 这意味着该空白和千位分隔符允许但不是货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要显式定义的元素 (如货币符号，千位分隔符和空格)，可能会包含`s`，使用方法重载。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method overload. 参数`s`使用中的格式设置信息分析对象初始化为当前系统区域性。Parameter `s` is parsed using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current system culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 将字符串分析使用的格式信息的其他某个指定区域性，请使用方法重载。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other specified culture, use the method overload. 如有必要，值`s`使用舍入为最接近舍入。If necessary, the value of `s` is rounded using rounding to nearest. 一个对象具有 29 位精度。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`表示具有多个 29 位，但有小数部分和位于范围内的数字和，数字舍入，未被截断，到使用舍入为最接近的 29 位。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在分析操作期间分隔符时遇到的`s`参数，以及适用的货币或十进制数和组分隔符是相同的分析操作假定，分隔符是十进制分隔符，而不是一组分隔符。If during a parse operation a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将转换为数字值的字符串表示值。The following example uses the method to convert the string representations of numeric values to values. 它假定该 EN-US 当前区域性。It assumes that en-US is the current culture.
